field.label: Brand Attribute Code
field.comment: Identifier of the attribute which contains the information about brands in your store. Search for that code in Catalog > Attributes > Manage Attributes.

field.label: Show Brand Image
field.comment: If set to "No", brand image will be replaced with brand name (simple text).

field.label: Show Text If No Brand Image
field.comment:
If set to "Yes": if brand image doesn't exist, it will be replaced with brand name (simple text).
If set to "No": if brand image doesn't exist, there will bo no info about brand.

field.label: Brand Logo is a Link to...
field.comment:
With this option, you can decide whether brand logo is a link, e.g., to search results page.
Set to "Custom Page" if you want the logo to be a link to custom pages (e.g., category view pages, CMS pages, pages created by 3rd-party extensions etc.) - more options will be displayed below.

field.label: Base Path of Brand Pages
field.comment:
Path specified in this field will be appended with the brand name to create a link to the brand page.
Leave empty if no base path is needed. Path is relative to the store base URL. Do not add leading or trailing slashes. For more details please refer to the user guide.

field.label: Append Category URL Suffix
field.comment: If Category URL Suffix exists (in System > Configuration > Catalog), it can be appended at the end of the URL of a brand page. For example: www.example.com/brands/apple.html (assuming that .html was set as Category URL Suffix).

field.label: URL Key Separator
field.comment:
Specify character which will be used as a word separator to generate links to custom brand pages. Brand name has to be simplified to be used in URL. Module will strip all whitespace characters and other non-letter and non-digit characters in brand name and replace them with separator. More information can be found in the user guide.
Example:
if brand name is Marks & Spencer and separator is hyphen (-), the brand name in URL will be the following: marks-spencer
Important:
Hyphen (-) is the recommended separator. Other separators, such as underscores (_) or plus-signs (+) should be avoided. Source: link.

field.label: Image URL Key Separator
field.comment:
Specify character which will be used as a word separator in the names of brand image files.
Important:
The Image URL Key Separator field was added for backward compatibility. In next versions this field will be removed and the character specified in the URL Key Separator field will also be used in the names of brand image files.
To prepare your store for this, we recommend to use hyphen (-) as the separator for images. In previous versions underscore (_) was the default separator for images. So what you need to do is to enter hyphen in the Image URL Key Separator field and edit names of all your brand images: replace underscores with hyphens.
Example:
change file name louis_vuitton.png to louis-vuitton.png

field.label: All Brands
field.comment: If set to "Yes", all existing brands will be displayed. If set to "No", you will be able to select brands in the field below.

field.label: Selected Brands
field.comment: Select brands which you want to display

field.label: Brands Assigned To Products
field.comment: If set to "Yes", display only those brands, which are currently assigned to products.

field.label: Brands Assigned To Products In Stock
field.comment: If set to "Yes", display only those brands, which are currently assigned to products which are in stock.

field.label: Timeout
field.comment: To enable automatic scrolling, specify time (in milliseconds) between slide transitions. Leave empty to disable automatic scrolling. Note that 1000 miliseconds = 1 second.

field.label: Speed
field.comment: Duration (in milliseconds) of scrolling animation. Applied to scrolling with arrows (and touch swipe).

field.label: Automatic Scrolling Speed
field.comment: Duration (in milliseconds) of scrolling animation. Applied to automatic scrolling (if Timeout was specified) and to scrolling with pagination.

field.label: Pause on Hover
field.comment: If enabled, when the slider is mouseovered then the automatic transition functionality will pause.

field.label: Lazy Loading
field.comment: Delays loading of images to speed up page loading. Images outside of viewport will not be loaded before user scrolls to them.
